intro: Satyrium eriostomum, commonly known as the pink sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and often succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually hairy and adapted to reduce water loss, reflecting its drought-tolerant nature.
